title: New York City Tequila and Mezcal Fest
description: Discover, sip, and savor tequila and mezcal at the New York City Tequila and Mezcal Fest with over 100 styles, live music, and delicious food available to purchase.
address: Chelsea Industrial, 535-549 West 28th Street, New York, NY 10001

title: Krispy Kreme Day of Dozens
description: Double your donuts during Krispy Kreme's Day of Dozens promotion. Get a free dozen glazed doughnuts with the purchase of any dozen at participating locations.

title: Broadway Under the Stars
description: Live performances from Broadway shows at the Shops at Columbus Circle.
address: The Shops at Columbus Circle, UWS

title: Salsa Party in a Museum
description: An evening of salsa, beginning with a class led by professional dancers followed by live music, social dancing, and performances.
address: Brooklyn Museum’s Rubin Lobby, Prospect Heights

title: Uptown Showdown: Swifties vs. The Beyhive
description: A comedy debate series where Taylor Swift battles Beyoncé.
address: Leonard Nimoy Thalia Theater at Symphony Space, UWS

title: John and Scott: Two Person Improv
description: Improv show featuring former 30 Rock cast members Scott Adsit and John Lutz.

title: The Mari Lwyd Pub Crawl: A Theatrical Pub Crawl
description: A group of actors lead you through Industry City’s watering holes, performing short play scenes along the way.

title: Futuros, New Ideas in Composition
description: New Latin Wave brings their Latine composers showcase to Lincoln Center’s David Rubenstein Atrium for four nights.
address: Lincoln Center’s David Rubenstein Atrium, UWS

title: Comedy Ugly: A Comedy Strip Show
description: Standup show where performers remove an article of clothing between jokes.

title: Planet Yes: Ugly Sweater Disco
description: Turn your ugly holiday sweater into art on the dance floor at House of Yes’s ugly sweater disco party.
cost: Free before midnight with RSVP, $10 otherwise

title: Annual Dumbo Holiday Lighting
description: Join the annual Dumbo holiday lighting event at Dumbo Archway + Plaza.

title: 100th Annual Washington Square Park Tree Lighting
description: Celebrate the 100th annual tree lighting at Washington Square Park.

title: Fantastic Fiction
description: The speculative-fiction reading series at KGB Bar welcomes authors Sarah Pinsker and Yume Kitasei.

title: Metropolitan with Whit Stillman and Chris Eigeman
description: Screening of Whit Stillman's Metropolitan (1990), followed by Q+A with Stillman and actor Chris Eigeman.

title: Night Flight Music Video Film Festival
description: Streaming channel Night Flight's music video film festival presents the 10 winners of its second annual music video competition, followed by Q+A with Stuart Shapiro and director Rich Murray.

title: Meat Puppet Presents: Cult Classics: The Thing
description: Warm up with a screening of John Carpenter’s The Thing (1982) that includes trivia and movie-related drag performances before the show and during intermission.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s with stand-up by Isabel Hagen, Lance Weiss, Ritch Duncan, and Will Purpura.

title: McSweeney’s Issue 75 Release Party
description: Release party for McSweeney’s Issue 75, featuring brief readings from contributors.
address: The Francis Kite Club, Alphabet City

title: Punderdome: Comedy Pun Slam
description: Pun-masters have a war of the words at the beloved pun-slinging competition.

title: Taiyaki NYC Christmas Tree Cones
description: Taiyaki's Christmas tree ice cream cones (matcha ice cream, crushed peppermint sprinkles, and a fondant star with a choice of waffle or filled custard or red bean cone) are back for the holiday season. 2 for $8-12. Chinatown and Williamsburg locations.

title: 21st Annual Brevitas Festival of the Short Poem
description: 50+ poets will say more with less (14 lines max each) at the 21st annual Brevitas Festival of the Short Poem, a celebration of the publication of the 2024 Brevitas anthology. A short poem open mic will follow.

title: The Elements of Marie Curie: How the Glow of Radium Lit a Path for Women in Science
description: Science writer Dava Sobel discusses her new biography on pioneering scientist Marie Curie and the untold story of the many young women who worked in her lab. In conversation with science journalist and author Angela Saini.
address: NYPL Stephen A. Schwarzman Building’s Celeste Auditorium, Midtown

title: Phantom of the Paradise 50th Anniversary with Paul Williams
description: BAM Rose Cinemas hosts an anniversary screening of Brian De Palma's 1974 comedy-horror rock cult classic, Phantom of the Paradise, which will be followed by Q+A with singer, songwriter, composer, and actor Paul Williams.

title: Young Hot Sluts: A Matchmaking Show
description: Comedian Carly Ann Filbin makes love connections while making you laugh at this IRL matchmaking show.
